conclusion: Understanding shadow position and size changes with light source movement.
Shadow position moves forward as light source moves backward.
Shadow size decreases as light source moves farther away.
Shadow A is cast by cylindrical object.
Shadow A will move forward and become smaller.
Shadow B is cast by small rectangular object.
Shadow B will move forward and become smaller.
Shadow C is cast by tall, thin object.
Shadow C will move forward and become smaller.
Shadow D is cast by triangular object.
Shadow D will move forward and become smaller.
Initial position and size of shadows A, B, C, and D.
Effect of moving the light source backward: shadows move forward and decrease in size.
Final answer: all shadows will move forward and become smaller.
